text: Charles Richard Webb (June 9, 1939 - June 16, 2020) was an American novelist. He was the author of several novels. His most famous work is the 1963 novel The Graduate, which was made into a movie of the same name (1967). Webb was born in San Francisco, California. His other best known novels include The Marriage of a Young Stockbroker and Home School. Webb died at a hospital in East Sussex, England on June 16, 2020 at the age of 81.Charles Webb, novelist who found fame, if not fortune, with his novel The Graduate â€“ obituary ==References== ==Other websites== *Charles Web - The Dropout and the Liberty Corner Nudist Camp Caretaker Category:American novelists Category:Writers from San Francisco Category:1939 births Category:2020 deaths
title: Charles Webb (author)
